finding: Human bocavirus (HBV) is a newly discovered parvovirus associated with respiratory tract infections, particularly in children.
HBV1 is the most prevalent genotype, accounting for 90% of HBV infections in Iranian children.
HBV infection is common, with a prevalence rate of 10.7% in young children with respiratory tract infections in Iran.
HBV infection is associated with a high rate of co-infections, particularly with respiratory syncytial virus (RSV).
HBV plays a significant role in respiratory tract infections in young children, suggesting its importance as a causative pathogen.
